required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Phase 3 Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Triple Therapy With CJ-12420 in H. Pylori Positive Patients
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 3, Randomized, Double-blind, Active-controlled, Multicenter Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of a Triple Therapy With CJ-12420, Amoxicillin and Clarithromycin in H. Pylori Positive Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The current study is designed to demonstrate the non-inferiority of CJ-12420-based triple therapy (CJ-12420, amoxicillin and clarithromycin) versus lansoprazole-based triple therapy (lansoprazole, amoxicillin and clarithromycin) in H. pylori eradication rate and to evaluate the safety of CJ-12420 following oral administration of either triple therapy twice daily for 7 days in H. pylori positive patients.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a double blind, randomized, active controlled, phase 3 study. Subjects will be randomly assigned to one of the two treatment groups (CJ-12420 50mg, lansoprazole 30mg). All subjects will be asked to take 5 tablets include clarithromycin, amoxicillin twice a day for 7 days.
After the treatment, UBT test will be conducted to confirm the Helicobacter pylori eradication.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Subjects will be considered to succeed in achieving H. pylori eradication if subject's UBT test (Eradication Assessment)

intervention.description: CJ-12420 or Lansoprazole +Clarithromycin/Amoxicillin will be administrated twice a day, for 7 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- H. pylori positive at screening
- Complain of gastric discomfort symptom
Exclusion Criteria:
- Having received prior therapy for eradication of H. pylori
- Prior use of proton pump inhibitors (PPIs), H2 receptor blockers, at a full dosage within 14 days
- Prior use of H. pylori eradication effective antibiotis, bismuth within 14 days
